alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Polk (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Greeley, southern Nance, northern Merrick, central Polk and northeastern Howard Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1015 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Silver Creek to near Fullerton to Wolbach. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Silver Creek around 1020 PM CDT. Osceola around 1035 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Shelby, Palmer and Clarks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
